subject: Cricket
lead_paragraph: India’s Sachin Tendulkar became only the third batsman in history to score 11,000 Test runs on the second day of the second test against England yesterday in Nottingham. Tendulkar, 34, was playing his 139th test. The others to reach 11,000 are the world record-holder Brian Lara (11,953) and the former Australia captain Allan Border (11,174).
